title: Brazil: Citibank Hall Will Be the New Name of Credicard Hall, Brazil's Premier Performance Venue
summary: São Paulo - Starting November 21, one of São Paulo's landmark entertainment venues, currently known as Credicard Hall, will have a new name. The country's leading and most versatile show arena will now be called Citibank Hall. The name change underscores Citi's commitment to offering its clients exclusive benefits.
tag-1: Brazil: Citibank Hall Will Be the New Name of Credicard Hall, Brazil's Premier Performance Venue
tag-3: São Paulo – Starting November 21, one of São Paulo's landmark entertainment venues, currently known as Credicard Hall, will have a new name. The country's leading and most versatile show arena will now be called Citibank Hall. The name change underscores Citi's commitment to offering its clients exclusive benefits.
tag-4: "Our goal is to consolidate our focus on the Premium segment by offering our clients not only differentiated financial services but also access to exclusive benefits," Citi Brazil President Helio Magalhães explained. With this change, Citi will now have its name on the country's top two entertainment spaces, Citibank Hall Rio and Citibank Hall São Paulo, in cities that are among the bank's most strategic markets."
tag-5: In addition to sporting the Citi brand, the São Paulo venue will undergo renovations, including more comfortable box seating.
tag-6: In honor of the rebranding, Citi account and card holders will enjoy special benefits, such as a 25 percent discount on shows, advance ticket sales, VIP ticket counter and entrances, reserved parking spaces and waived ticket delivery fees.
tag-7: According to Fernando Alterio, President of TIME FOR FUN, the name change reflects the solid partnership between the two companies. "We have had a contract with Citi since the building now known as Citibank Hall first opened. For 14 years, we have worked in synergy to offer the best services and advantages, promoting the hall's reputation as the top place to see shows in South America," he noted.
tag-8: As of October, the venue has been affiliated with Citi World Privileges, a global Citi program in the United States and Asia that is now being expanded to Brazil. The program focuses on four areas – Dining, Entertainment, Shopping and Travel – and offers Citi clients exclusive benefits, such as discounts at restaurants and stores, as well as events at Citibank Hall in Rio and São Paulo.
tag-9: An exciting and diverse lineup of shows is being offered to boost Citibank Hall's reputation as one of the country's top entertainment venues. In 2012, according to Pollstar magazine, it was number one in ticket sales in all of South America. The November program features international superstars Cat Stevens (Yusuf Islam) and Sarah Brightman, and Italian singer Laura Pausini will perform in 2014.
tag-10: Structure – Designed to feature mega shows, Broadway musicals, operas and other live performances with the most up to date technology and standards of comfort, Citibank Hall is one of the South America's most modern entertainment venues. Since opening in September 1999, it has hosted world-class productions such as Blue Man Group, Stomp, China's Imperial Circus, Lord of the Dance, Carmina Burana, Cuba's National Ballet, Waterwall and others. Ringo Starr, Bob Dylan, Donna Summer, Alanis Morissette, Simply Red, Deep Purple, Scorpions, Simple Plan, a-ha, Keane, Sarah Brightman, Megadeth, Alejandro Sanz and Laura Pausini are just some of the musical stars from around the world who have dazzled audiences from its stage.
tag-11: Top Brazilian performers such as Roberto Carlos, João Gilberto, Marisa Monte, Caetano Veloso, Gal Costa, Maria Bethânia, Ney Matogrosso, Gilberto Gil, Paulinho da Viola, Djavan, Maria Rita, Ana Carolina, Fábio Jr. Zezé di Camargo e Luciano, Zeca Pagodinho, Skank, and Paralamas also make frequent appearances.
tag-12: The venue was the first in Brazil to offer standing room for up to 7,000 spectators and seating for 4,800 in safety and comfort. The 15,000-square-meter space is divided into four sections, three of them with a fixed capacity: an upper level with space for 1,820 people; box seats for 282, and suites for 440. Spacious audience seating offers a range of accommodation options. Thanks to its capacity and cutting-edge technological innovations, Citibank Hall puts São Paulo on the map as one of the world's leading entertainment venues.
tag-13: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.

tag-15: TIME FOR FUN T4F is the leading live entertainment company in South America, with operations in Brazil, Argentina and Chile. The winner of Billboard magazine's Top International Independent Promoter 2012 award and the Caboré Award 2012, Brazil's most prestigious advertising and media award, T4F currently operates six of the most important entertainment venues in South America, three of which are ranked among the top 20 venues worldwide in terms of number of tickets sold in 2012, according to Pollstar. T4F has organized Brazilian tours by Madonna, Lady Gaga, Linkin Park, Roger Waters, U2, Coldplay, Pearl Jam, Ozzy Ozbourne and Bon Jovi, as well as Cirque du Soleil, Disney On Ice and China's Imperial Circus. Among the acts we promote are Circuito Nova Schin Stock Car and Copa Petrobras de Marcas, along with top musicals such as Disney's "Lion King." We have organized some of the country's leading shows at Oca in Ibirapuera Park in São Paulo. In the second half of 2013 we brought Justin Bieber and Black Sabbath to Brazil, as well as the Planet Earth festival, and in 2014 the smash hit One Direction will perform at the newly inaugurated Allianz Park. Coming up, T4F will present one of the world's top music festivals, Lollapalooza.
